column2: A service that makes it easy to set up and operate a scalable AWS managed Microsoft Active Directory in the AWS Cloud.

column1: What is AWS Managed Microsoft AD in AWS Directory Service?
column2: A managed service that provides Active Directory features to your cloud-based applications and AWS resources using standard AD administration tools.

column1: What is the AD Connector in AWS Directory Service?
column2: A proxy service that allows AWS services to use your existing on-premises Active Directory without syncing or storing data in the cloud.

column1: How does Simple AD differ from AWS Managed Microsoft AD?
column2: Simple AD is a more cost-effective solution with basic AD features, best suited for smaller businesses that have less demanding directory needs.

column1: What are common use cases for AWS Directory Service?
column2: Hosting Active Directory-dependent applications, managing EC2 instances with Group Policy, single sign-on to AWS services, and managing RDS for SQL Server instances.
